intro: Silene cintrana, commonly known as the Canary Islands pink, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native environment. Silene cintrana has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. It is considered an endemic species, found only in specific regions of the Canary Islands.
